natspec.author: metapriest, adrian.wachel, marek.babiarz, radoslaw.gorecki
natspec.details: The contract cannot introspect into the contents of the merkle tree, except when provided a merkle proof

addMerkleRoot(bytes32,bytes32,address,ui.details: Anyone may call this function, therefore we must make sure trees cannot affect each otherRoot hash should be built from (destination, totalCoins, startTime, endTime, lockPeriodEndTime)
addMerkleRoot(bytes32,bytes32,address,ui.notice: Add a new merkle tree to the contract, creating a new merkle-vesting-schedule

params.ipfsHash: the ipfs hash of the entire dataset, used for redundance so that creator can ensure merkleproof are always computable
params.newRoot: root hash of merkle tree representing vesting schedules
params.tokenAddress: the address of the token contract that is being distributed
params.tokenBalance: the amount of tokens user wishes to use to fund the airdrop, note trees can be under/overfunded

depositTokens(uint256,uint256).details: Anyone may call this function, the only risk here is that the token contract is malicious, rendering the tree maliciousIf the tree is over-funded, excess funds are lost. No clear way to get around this without zk-proofs
depositTokens(uint256,uint256).notice: Add funds to an existing merkle-vesting-schedule

params.treeIndex: index into array-like map of merkleTrees
params.value: the amount of tokens user wishes to use to fund the airdrop, note trees can be underfunded

initialize(uint256,address,uint256,uint2.details: Anyone may call this function, the only risk here is that the token contract is malicious, rendering the tree maliciousIf the tree is over-funded, excess funds are lost. No clear way to get around this without zk-proofs of global tree statsThe contract has no knowledge of the vesting schedules until this function is called
initialize(uint256,address,uint256,uint2.notice: Called once per recipient of a vesting schedule to initialize the vesting schedule

params.endTime: time vesting schedule completes, can be past or future
params.lockPeriodEndTime: time that coins become unlocked, can be after endTime
params.proof: array of hashes linking leaf hash of (destination, totalCoins, startTime, endTime, lockPeriodEndTime) to root
params.startTime: time that vesting schedule starts, can be past or future
params.totalCoins: amount of tokens to be released after vesting completes
params.treeIndex: index into array-like map of merkleTrees

withdraw(uint256,uint256).details: Anyone may call this function for anyone else, funds go to destination regardless, it's just a question ofwho provides the proof and pays the gas, msg.sender is not used in this function
withdraw(uint256,uint256).notice: Claim funds as a recipient in the merkle-drop

params.treeIndex: index into array-like map of merkleTrees, which tree should we apply the proof to?

natspec.notice: This contract is permissionless and public facing. Any fees must be included in the data of the merkle tree.
natspec.title: A factory pattern for merkle-vesting, that is, a time release schedule for tokens, using merkle proofs to scale
